dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6366 IH: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act with respect to the work geographic index for physician payments under the Medicare program, and to revise the phase-in of clinical laboratory test payment changes under such program.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Hudson introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act with respect to the work geographic index for physician payments under the Medicare program, and to revise the phase-in of clinical laboratory test payment changes under such program.

section.header: Extending floor for work geographic index
section.text: Section 1848(e)(1)(E) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–4(e)(1)(E)) is amended by striking 2024 and inserting 2025.

section.header: Revising phase-in of Medicare clinical laboratory test payment changes

subsection.header: Revised phase-In of reductions from private payor rate implementation
subsection.text: Section 1834A(b)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395m–1(b)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking 2026 and inserting 2027; and

subparagraph.text: in clause (ii), by striking 2023 and inserting 2024; and
in clause (iii), by striking 2024 through 2026 and inserting 2025 through 2027.

subsection.header: Revised reporting period for reporting of private sector payment rates for establishment of Medicare payment rates
subsection.text: Section 1834A(a)(1)(B) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395m–1(a)(1)(B)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i), by striking 2023 and inserting 2024; and
in clause (ii), by striking 2024 each place it appears and inserting 2025.
